pull.title: change to declarative sentences. simplify links
pull.body:
The current version is lifted directly from [bitcoin.org](https://bitcoin.org/en/), i.e.

    Bitcoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate with no central authority or banks; 
    managing transactions and the issuing of bitcoins is carried out collectively by the 
    network.

So as an improvement to readability I propose to change the present perfect progressive such as `managing` and `issuing` to declarative sentences for the form `management` & `issuance`. 

Also I chopped up the last sentence which was kind of long, into two shorter ones with the links.

events.message:
change to declarative sentences

readability improvement- change to declarative sentences from present perfect progressive `management` instead of `managing`, `issuance` instead of `issuing`, etc.

events.body: ACK adding `the` on line 14 and the link to bitcoin.org on 18, however not convinced the other wording changes are improvements.
Closing, as the link in the README is actually already clickable, if someone wants to fix the typo they can do.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,12 +10,12 @@ What is Bitcoin?
 
 Bitcoin is an experimental digital currency that enables instant payments to
 anyone, anywhere in the world. Bitcoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate
-with no central authority: managing transactions and issuing money are carried
-out collectively by the network. Bitcoin Core is the name of open source
+with no central authority: management of transactions and issuance of money are carried
+out collectively by the network. Bitcoin Core is the name of the open source
 software which enables the use of this currency.
 
-For more information, as well as an immediately useable, binary version of
-the Bitcoin Core software, see https://bitcoin.org/en/download, or read the
+An immediately useable binary version of
comments.body: I'm not native language speaker, but the word 'useable' is strange.

comments.body:
The text as is seems to be copied from [bitcoin.org](https://bitcoin.org/en/), for instance: 

    Bitcoin uses peer-to-peer technology to operate with no central authority or banks;
    managing transactions and the issuing of bitcoins is carried out collectively by the 
    network.

Yeah, I see what you mean- how about `immediately useful`?
